issue.title: Better support comparing lists / iterable objects
issue.body:
There is new feature in 3.4.0 version:
`assertThat(...).isEqualToComparingFieldByFieldRecursively(...)`

but comparing lists is still poor, because we have to use equals(...) method when comparing two objects - it is used by default?

We would like to have methods like:

`assertThat(<some iterable>).containsExactlyElementsOf(<some iterable>)` - already provided.
`assertThat(<some iterable>).containsExactlyElementsOfComparingFieldByField(<some iterable>)` - really missing :+1: 
`assertThat(<some iterable>).containsExactlyElementsOfComparingFieldByFieldRecursively(<some iterable>)` - missing too :+1: :+1:  :)

BTW, if possible, I could do this.

body: @sta-szek I can give implementing the `usingFieldByFieldElementRecursivelyComparator()` method a try, or would you like to do it?
If you don't mind I can give a try :)

You a welcome to give it a try. :)

The feature should added to `AbstractObjectArrayAssert` as well as to `AbstractIterableAssert` I think.

If you any questions @joel-costigliola and I are there to help. :)

@sta-szek you're welcome to contribute :)
I would simply rename the method to `usingRecursiveFieldByFieldElementComparator`
@sta-szek Are you still working on this? If you are not I could give it a try.

Ok, sorry for the confusion, but currently I am working on another tester-library, so I don't have time for this right now.
It would be nice If you could implement this solution.
Next time I'll try to help you :)

PS the eclipse formatter is really poor (I use IntelliJ, which has much more options) and when I import eclipse formatter, intellij overrides some options, but the rest is unmodified, so importing eclipse formatter to intellij is not good solution.
There is eclipse formatter plugin for intellij, but if you use it you lost a lot of helpful formatting options, which I think, should be used in every project.

My recommendation is to use intellij instead of eclipse, but of course I dont push you :smiley: 

PS2
Thanks for giving me a try ;)

issue.title: add #usingRecursiveFieldByFieldElementComparator to AbstractIterableA

repository.name: assertj
